intro: Cistus hirsutus var. subglaber, commonly known as the woolly rockrose, is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its dense, silver-gray foliage and small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant is adapted to rocky and dry environments, exhibiting drought tolerance and well-developed root systems. Its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs, which help reduce water loss and reflect sunlight. This species is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
